rev.comment: /* Week 5 (November 7 â November 13) */ crowd, not just OO protestors per se, remove ref to stairs he was NOT pushed down.
rev.diff:
Line 385: Line 385: â
On November 10, the one month anniversary of the Occupy Oakland demonstration, a man was fatally shot about 25 yards away from the plaza's tent encampment.<ref name=NY10>{{cite web|last=Walter|first=Shoshana|title=Occupy Oakland and News Media Coexist Uneasily|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/13/us/occupy-oakland-and-news-media-coexist-uneasily.html|publisher=[[New York Times]]|accessdate=13 November 2011}}</ref> Occupy Oakland medics responded to the victim until the police and paramedics arrived. There are mixed reports about whether the people involved in the shooting were connected to Occupy Oakland. <ref name=NY10/> <ref name=NPR10>{{cite web|last=Kaste|first=Martin|title=Occupy Oakland Movement Tries To Regroup After Shooting|url=http://www.npr.org/blogs/thetwo-way/2011/11/11/142255723/occupy-oakland-movement-tries-to-regroup-after-shooting|publisher=NPR|accessdate=13 November 2011}}</ref> Randy Davis, a cameraman for KGO-TV was filming the Occupy Oakland medics rendering [[first aid]] treatment to the victim when some protesters formed a ring around the victim shouting, âNo cameras!â and âNo media!â Davis was hit in the head and pushed towards a ledge overlooking a BART station stairwell before other protesters intervened.<ref name=NY10/> In response to the shooting, demonstrators observed a moment of silence, prayer, and held a candlelight vigil for the victim, led by one of the camp chaplains.<ref>{{cite news|title=Shots fired near 'Occupy Oakland,' one dead|url=http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8427634|accessdate=November 10, 2011|newspaper=KGO-TV|date=November 13, 2011}}</ref>
+
On November 10, the one month anniversary of the Occupy Oakland demonstration, a man was fatally shot about 25 yards away from the plaza's tent encampment.<ref name=NY10>{{cite web|last=Walter|first=Shoshana|title=Occupy Oakland and News Media Coexist Uneasily|url=http://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/13/us/occupy-oakland-and-news-media-coexist-uneasily.html|publisher=[[New York Times]]|accessdate=13 November 2011}}</ref> Occupy Oakland medics responded to the victim until the police and paramedics arrived. There are mixed reports about whether the people involved in the shooting were connected to Occupy Oakland. <ref name=NY10/> <ref name=NPR10>{{cite web|last=Kaste|first=Martin|title=Occupy Oakland Movement Tries To Regroup After Shooting|url=http://www.npr.org/blogs/thetwo-way/2011/11/11/142255723/occupy-oakland-movement-tries-to-regroup-after-shooting|publisher=NPR|accessdate=13 November 2011}}</ref> Randy Davis, a local cameraman, was filming Occupy Oakland medics as they rendered [[first aid]] treatment to the victim when some a crowd formed a ring around the victim shouting, âNo cameras!â and âNo media!â Davis said he was hit and pushed by the crowd before others nearby intervened.<ref name=NY10/> In response to the shooting, demonstrators observed a moment of silence, prayer, and held a candlelight vigil for the victim, led by one of the camp chaplains.<ref>{{cite news|title=Shots fired near 'Occupy Oakland,' one dead|url=http://abclocal.go.com/kgo/story?section=news/local/east_bay&id=8427634|accessdate=November 10, 2011|newspaper=KGO-TV|date=November 13, 2011}}</ref>
